title: Syria's infernal cycle of revenge: 'I don't trust men from my own community'
summary: After the killings targeting the Alawite community, Syrian society is struggling to extricate itself from the crimes of the past.

title: Ukraine: Putin and Trump agree to end 'energy and infrastructure' attacks
summary: According to the White House, US and Russian Presidents Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin held a phone call for over two hours, speaking about US proposals on a ceasefire plan for the war in Ukraine.

title: Netanyahu says Israeli strikes that killed more than 400 in Gaza 'only the beginning'
summary: All further ceasefire negotiations will take place 'under fire,' said Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, after the strikes that shattered a two-month ceasefire.

title: Federal judge blocks dismantling of USAID, saying it violates US Constitution
summary: A federal judge has ruled that Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency likely violated the Constitution by dismantling the US Agency for International Development (USAID), indefinitely halting further cuts. The decision, which challenges the Trump administration's efforts to gut the foreign aid agency, marks a major legal setback for Musk.

title: Trump eyes Canada's water to fight shortages in the US
summary: Washington has suspended negotiations on the Columbia River Treaty. The river meanders for almost 2,000 kilometers between the two countries.

title: 'Mickey 17': Bong Joon-ho's joyous narrative mess
summary: Bong Joon-ho's visionary new film casts Robert Pattinson in the role of a man who can be endlessly re-created for the puposes of a scientific mission.

title: US aid freeze hampers work of human rights activists in Iran
summary: The closure of the US Agency for International Development on February 3 has had a massive impact on the missions of journalists and dozens of NGOs working for democracy, the environment and equality in Iran.

title: By massively bombing Gaza, Netanyahu destroys ceasefire with Hamas
summary: The Israeli army resumed its offensive on the territory, killing more than 400 Palestinians on Tuesday, according to the Ministry of Health in Gaza. Israel accuses Hamas of refusing to compromise on negotiations to free the hostages.

title: US Supreme Court chief justice rebukes Trump's  call for a judge's impeachment
summary: US President Donald Trump called for District Judge James Boasberg's impeachment over the judge's order to suspend the deportation of 238 alleged gang members, which went ahead despite the injunction.

title: Leaders of Rwanda and DR Congo back ceasefire in Qatar talks
summary: The presidents of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of the Congo met in Qatar on Tuesday and reaffirmed their support for an 'immediate and unconditional ceasefire.' The meeting, brokered by Qatar's emir, comes as the Rwanda-backed M23 rebels continue their deadly advance in eastern DRC, where over 7,000 people have reportedly been killed since January.

title: Israeli army carries out deadly strikes on the Gaza Strip
summary: The Israeli bombardments came two months after a ceasefire took effect in January.

title: German lawmakers approve massive defense and infrastructure spending plans
summary: The large package of measures, aimed at waiving Germany's debt rules for defense spending and setting up an infrastructure investment fund, was passed by the outgoing Bundestag, with 513 votes in favor to 207 against.

title: In Lebanon and Syria, Israel continues its war of attrition
summary: The Israeli air force is bombing sites linked to Hezbollah to prevent it from rebuilding its arsenal and accusing Palestinian Islamic Jihad of preparing attacks from Syria.

title: French PM summons ministers to end rift over hijab in sport
summary: Prime Minister François Bayrou emphasized the government's position was to back a bill banning the wearing of religious symbols from professional and amateur sports.

title: Hungarian parliament passes a bill banning Pride events
summary: The amendment to Hungary's 'child protection' legislation, making it an offense to hold events for LGBTQ+ rights, passed with 136 votes in favor to 27.

title: Diplomatic crisis between France and Algeria worsens
summary: French Interior Minister Bruno Retailleau announced the start of a 'graduated response' by France following Algeria's refusal to accept a list of people to be deported.

title: EU Parliament corruption: Five people charged in Huawei graft probe
summary: Following raids conducted in Belgium and Portugal, an investigation into suspected graft in the European Parliament linked to Chinese tech giant Huawei led to 5 people being charged for corruption-related offences.

title: French male film stars tell #MeToo inquiry about 'clumsy' remarks
summary: Jean Dujardin and Gilles Lellouche were among the famous male actors who appeared before parliamentary inquiry into sexual violence in the cinema industry.
